{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:06:49.680
    | text      = So Alex has a overarching narrative on this show, and it essentially has to do with the
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:06:54.879
    | text      = situation with Russia and Ukraine.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:06:57.759
    | text      = And this is before Alex's actual show bumper starts.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:07:03.000
    | text      = He's just muttering over.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:07:06.560
    | text      = So here's how he begins.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:07:08.519
    | text      = Ladies and gentlemen, this is a maximum red alert.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:07:11.480
    | text      = Vladimir Putin is officially threatened worldwide thermal nuclear war.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:07:15.920
    | text      = If NATO continues their invasion, red alert, maximum alert, tune in now, spread the word.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:07:21.680
    | text      = Info Wars, the most band network in the world.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:07:25.800
    | text      = So that's the sting.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:07:27.120
    | text      = And then it goes into his bumper and he starts the show.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:07:29.639
    | text      = So that's how you know this is serious.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:07:32.079
    | text      = Ladies and gentlemen, a total thermonuclear war begins now.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:07:36.639
    | text      = Info Wars.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:07:37.879
    | text      = So yeah, there were some comments that Putin made after his press conference, or I guess
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:07:42.959
    | text      = it was in the press conference after his meeting with Emmanuel Macron recently.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:07:49.000
    | text      = And there's some talk of moving some missiles and what have you.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:07:52.120
    | text      = This may be interpreted as a direct threat of nuclear war and escalation, but either
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:07:56.959
    | text      = way it's not great, but I think Alex might be a little bit buck wild on this.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:02.959
    | text      = It's important to understand any kind of threat that Russia may be making vis-a-vis discussing
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:08.959
    | text      = their nuclear capabilities in the context of political history, because Putin and his
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:13.959
    | text      = administration do this a lot.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:15.600
    | text      = No, I've never heard of them doing this before.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:17.920
    | text      = In 2014, Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov threatened nuclear action against Ukraine if they tried
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:23.600
    | text      = to take back Crimea.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:24.839
    | text      = In 2007, they warned Poland and the Czech Republic that they could still nuke them,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:29.720
    | text      = even with Western anti-missile defenses, attempting to dissuade the countries from letting the
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:34.320
    | text      = US put these defense systems in their country to begin with.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:37.639
    | text      = Right.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:38.639
    | text      = That's a lot, and there's a pretty simple explanation.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:41.320
    | text      = It's one of the very few pieces of leverage that Putin and Russia actually have at their
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:45.440
    | text      = disposal to use.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:47.179
    | text      = And because of that, it's become a state policy to use threats of nuclear war in order to
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:51.279
    | text      = de-escalate situations that couldn't be de-escalated otherwise.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:56.600
    | text      = So Putin came into power in 2000, and shortly after that, that April, he put in place a
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:02.000
    | text      = new military doctrine, which replaced many key parts of the previous doctrine that had
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:07.200
    | text      = been put in in 1993.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:10.080
    | text      = One of the main pieces that's relevant to us now is that in the original version, nuclear
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:14.519
    | text      = arms could only be used, quote, in cases of a threat to the existence of the Russian Federation.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:21.379
    | text      = The new version expanded this to allow for their use, quote, in response to large-scale
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:25.399
    | text      = aggression utilizing conventional weapons in situations critical to the national security
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:30.440
    | text      = of the Russian Federation.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:32.200
    | text      = They opened it up a little bit.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:33.440
    | text      = Right, right, right.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:34.440
    | text      = Which is what you want from nuclear weapons policy.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:36.879
    | text      = Sure.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:37.879
    | text      = The former head of Poland's National Security Bureau, Stanislaw KoÅ¼e, explained how this
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:43.279
    | text      = works in practice in an article from Politico Europe, quote, the numerous events of Russian
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:49.399
    | text      = nuclear blackmailing add up to the Russian strategy of information warfare, which aims
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:54.320
    | text      = to intimidate the West and enable Russia to reconstruct its sphere of influence in ex-Soviet
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:59.240
    | text      = Union states.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:00.799
    | text      = It's a PR tactic.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:02.120
    | text      = Right.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:03.120
    | text      = So it's a bluff, but not one that you ever want to risk calling.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:09.480
    | text      = Not a fun bluff.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:10.679
    | text      = Don't fuck with that bluff.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:11.679
    | text      = Yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:12.679
    | text      = Many folks who speak on the matter view this as a propaganda tactic, because ultimately
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:15.980
    | text      = this nuclear deterrence also exists within the nuclear deterrence that many NATO countries
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:20.960
    | text      = also have nuclear capabilities.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:23.200
    | text      = Right.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:24.200
    | text      = So it goes both ways.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:25.399
    | text      = And Russia knows that if they were to actually use those nukes that they're posturing like
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:28.820
    | text      = they're going to, the response would be swift and devastating for all parties.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:33.320
    | text      = Their ultimate goal of protecting the Russian Federation from NATO influence wouldn't be
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:36.960
    | text      = served by the Russian Federation getting nuked, but the goal can be served by threatening
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:42.259
    | text      = to use nukes and banking on that threat being enough to intimidate and change the behaviors
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:46.519
    | text      = of NATO and the countries in the region that wish to join it.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:49.799
    | text      = Right.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:50.799
    | text      = This is a really serious situation and things are tense, but it's important to recognize
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:53.720
    | text      = how little Alex engages with any of this shit.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:56.639
    | text      = Putin has said that he's going to move some missiles, perhaps, and Alex starts his show
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:01.360
    | text      = doing this grotesque movie trailer voice about thermonuclear war.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:05.919
    | text      = When you recognize that the threats that Putin is deploying are part of his information warfare
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:10.360
    | text      = strategy, then you have to realize that all Alex is doing is either wittingly or unwittingly
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:14.559
    | text      = amplifying and playing right into that strategy.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:18.200
    | text      = The more this threat is hyped, the greater the chance of forcing a NATO de-escalation
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:22.200
    | text      = and capitulation to Putin's demands.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:24.879
    | text      = Right.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:25.879
    | text      = Again, the world is completely insane in 2022 and many things that would have been seen
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:30.480
    | text      = by conventional wisdom in the past 20 years as being impossible, I don't know if that
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:34.879
    | text      = holds true anymore, so I don't want to entirely downplay this situation.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:39.000
    | text      = The point I want to make is just that if Alex were half the geopolitical expert he pretends
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:42.960
    | text      = to be, he wouldn't engage with this piece of news this way, saying that Russia is threatening
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:48.159
    | text      = thermonuclear war, and he's going to get really extreme with it.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:51.480
    | text      = I mean, I think it's probably a bad idea, but that's just because I've never seen total
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:58.320
    | text      = nuclear war before, so, you know, maybe there are some positives that I haven't considered,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:03.360
    | text      = you know?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:04.360
    | text      = I haven't lived through one.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:05.360
    | text      = Yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:06.360
    | text      = I think that Alex really likes to use the specter of that possibility as, like, a way
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:10.799
    | text      = to excite people, and that stinks.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:17.139
    | text      = The end of all human life, come on baby, let's get it up!
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:20.519
    | text      = So Alex has this story about Putin, and he has a source on it, but it actually isn't
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:28.879
    | text      = his source, right?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:30.440
    | text      = So the source isn't a Daily Mail article.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:35.240
    | text      = Okay.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:36.240
    | text      = That's where it starts.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:37.240
    | text      = Right.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:38.240
    | text      = Alex did so much more digging on this thing, man.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:40.240
    | text      = Did he?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:41.240
    | text      = We'll see, we'll see.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:42.240
    | text      = Okay, alright.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:43.240
    | text      = On the edge of thermal nuclear war, when I saw this quote this morning in the Daily Mail,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:52.879
    | text      = I had trouble believing it, so I went and searched some of the quotes and found it nowhere
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:59.559
    | text      = else in the Western news.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:03.200
    | text      = So then our crew spent some time and found it in Russian, and we checked it and had it
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:08.679
    | text      = submitted, and indeed we found a version that has subtitles, where Vladimir Putin, the president
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:14.039
    | text      = of Russia, has threatened nuclear war, and said, within the blinking of an eye, he says,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:21.919
    | text      = you won't have time to blink your eye if NATO continues its Article 5 takeover, I've got
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:28.799
    | text      = the quotes right here in the video, of Ukraine in this proxy war, we're going to basically
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:35.440
    | text      = stop you.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:37.240
    | text      = Basically is in there, apparently.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:39.200
    | text      = So Alex is trying to pretend that he did all this legwork, and the crew dug up and found
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:42.960
    | text      = intel about this Putin speech that isn't in this Daily Mail article he read, but spoiler
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:47.000
    | text      = alert, that's all bullshit.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:49.480
    | text      = Eventually Alex plays this translation that they supposedly came up with, and it's just
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:54.080
    | text      = literally the video that's embedded in the Daily Mail article.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:57.399
    | text      = It even has the Daily Mail logo on it.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:00.279
    | text      = Sure, yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:01.279
    | text      = It's ridiculous.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:02.279
    | text      = But, you know, they got it from Russia.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:05.480
    | text      = Right.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:06.480
    | text      = And they're reading the subtitles, too, that are in that video.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:08.440
    | text      = Of course.
